column3: I cannot and will not recant anything, for to go against conscience is neither right nor safe. Here I stand, I can do no other, so help me God. Amen.
Music is an agreeable harmony for the honor of God and the permissible delights of the soul.

We all have the right of freedom of speech under the First Amendment. We all don't have to agree with one another on our opinions. Everyone in my circle, that I run around with, we all feel the same about God, country, integrity and character.
I have a dream that America will pray and God will forgive us our sins.
And poets, in my view, and I think the view of most people, do speak God's language - it's better, it's finer, it's language on a higher plane than ordinary people speak in their daily lives.

You hear a lot about God these days: God, the beneficent; God, the all-great; God, the Almighty; God, the most powerful; God, the giver of life; God, the creator of death. I mean, we're hearing about God all the time, so we better learn how to deal with it. But if we know anything about God, God is arbitrary.
There are two kinds of people: those who say to God, 'Thy will be done,' and those to whom God says, 'All right, then, have it your way.'
Heaven means to be one with God.
What ever disunites man from God, also disunites man from man.
God, I can push the grass apart and lay my finger on Thy heart.
God, as Truth, has been for me a treasure beyond price. May He be so to every one of us.
Our Lord has written the promise of resurrection, not in books alone, but in every leaf in springtime.

I just want to do God's will. And he's allowed me to go to the mountain. And I've looked over, and I've seen the promised land! I may not get there with you, but I want you to know tonight that we as a people will get to the promised land.
What God intended for you goes far beyond anything you can imagine.
People see God every day, they just don't recognize him.
All men are born with a nose and five fingers, but no one is born with a knowledge of God.
Where mercy, love, and pity dwell, there God is dwelling too.
God moves in a mysterious way, His wonders to perform. He plants his footsteps in the sea, and rides upon the storm.
Sometimes you ask God for something and you don't know what you're asking.
Sometimes God writes straightforward in twisted lines.
But I know God has big stuff planned that ultimately doesn't have anything to do with me.
God will never reject you. Whether you accept Him is your decision.
God is looking for people to use, and if you can get usable, he will wear you out. The most dangerous prayer you can pray is this: 'Use me.'
Start with God - the first step in learning is bowing down to God; only fools thumb their noses at such wisdom and learning.

The moment I have realized God sitting in the temple of every human body, the moment I stand in reverence before every human being and see God in him - that moment I am free from bondage, everything that binds vanishes, and I am free.
God is creating at every moment of the world's existence in and through the perpetually endowed creativity of the very stuff of the world.
